user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_m_algo:
```c
static enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3
get_m_algo (void)
{
  if (force_md5)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_MD5;
  else if (force_sha256)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_SHA256;
  else if (force_sha512_256)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_SHA512_256;

  /* No forced algorithm selection, let MHD to use default */
  return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_ANY_NON_SESSION;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
/* No forced algorithm selection, let MHD to use default */
  return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_ANY_NON_SESSION;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The final return statement is reachable when none of the force_* conditions are true; each if/else-if only returns when its condition is true, so control can flow to the final return. Therefore this fragment does not contain unreachable code.
